questions.q: Is someone talking loudly on their phone?
a: Ensure you write down everything so you can steal their identity.
This is why we can't have nice things.

questions.q: People blocking the exit when you try to get out?
a: Hold eye contact with the nearest one as you alight.
Block the entire doorway until they make way.
Take your sweet time getting off.
Try looking like you're about to vomit.
Seriously what is wrong with people?

questions.q: Have a complaint about our service?
a: Simply complete all 17 forms in triplicate at any station.
Visit us any time between 2.32pm and 2.48pm on the thirteenth Tuesday of every year!
We promise to get back to you within 14 working years.
Your call is important to us.
We're amazed it ever works tbqh.

questions.q: Remember to touch-on your Myki before you travel.
a: Make sure that's the only thing you touch during your trip ðŸ˜·
You never know what those AOs will do.

questions.q: So you think you can tram?
a: Then you should have seen that right-hand exit coming up.
Why'd you touch-on at Collins St then?
That'd be a nice change from our usual passengers.
Ask if you can take a photo for Manspreader Weekly.
Tell him he's not that big.

questions.q: Last seat taken by someone's handbag?
a: Show them how to place it on the floor.
A bit of passive-aggressive glaring often works.
Ask her how much the handbag's ticket cost.
